channel.title: Analytics on Yanir Seroussi | Data & AI for Startup Impact
channel.description: Recent content in Analytics on Yanir Seroussi | Data & AI for Startup Impact
channel.copyright: Text and figures licensed under CC BY-NC-ND 4.0 by Yanir Seroussi, except where noted otherwise

item.title: Your first Data-to-AI hire: Run a lovable process
item.description: Video and key points from the second part of a webinar on a startup’s first data hire, covering tips for defining the role and running the process.

item.title: Learn about Dataland to avoid expensive hiring mistakes
item.description: Video and key points from the first part of a webinar on a startup’s first data hire, covering data & AI definitions and high-level recommendations.

item.title: Is your tech stack ready for data-intensive applications?
item.description: Questions to assess the quality of tech stacks and lifecycles, with a focus on artificial intelligence, machine learning, and analytics.

item.title: Startup data health starts with healthy event tracking
item.description: Expanding on the startup health check question of tracking Kukuyeva’s five business aspects as wide events.

item.title: Assessing a startup's data-to-AI health
item.description: Reviewing the areas that should be assessed to determine a startup’s opportunities and challenges on the data/AI/ML front.

item.title: Substance over titles: Your first data hire may be a data scientist
item.description: Advice for hiring a startup’s first data person: match skills to business needs, consider contractors, and get help from data people.

item.title: Bootstrapping the right way?
item.description: Video and summary of a talk I gave at YOW! Data on bootstrap estimation of confidence intervals.

item.title: Defining data science in 2018
item.description: Updating my definition of data science to match changes in the field. It is now broader than before, but its ultimate goal is still to support decisions.

item.title: Customer lifetime value and the proliferation of misinformation on the internet
item.description: There’s a lot of misleading content on the estimation of customer lifetime value. Here’s what I learned about doing it well.

item.title: If you donâ€™t pay attention, data can drive you off a cliff
item.description: Seven common mistakes to avoid when working with data, such as ignoring uncertainty and confusing observed and unobserved quantities.

item.title: Making Bayesian A/B testing more accessible
item.description: A web tool I built to interpret A/B test results in a Bayesian way, including prior specification, visualisations, and decision rules.

item.title: Why you should stop worrying about deep learning and deepen your understanding of causality instead
item.description: Causality is often overlooked but is of much higher relevance to most data scientists than deep learning.

item.title: This holiday season, give me real insights
item.description: Some companies present raw data or information as “insights”. This post surveys some examples, and discusses how they can be turned into real insights.
